d6a4b964-9a71-4acc-b063-93e87a263fea.description: Earners of this badge have developed foundational Python knowledge and skills to transition and augment existing analytic skill sets. Badge earners can speak about Python programming language and syntax and can communicate with Data Science professionals about the use of Python to improve analytic outcomes. They can complete data-related tasks by extracting valuable insights from data through slice-and-dicing and filtering regions-of-interest from complex datasets.
d6a4b964-9a71-4acc-b063-93e87a263fea.name: Python - Bronze

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Python Basics for Analytics learning program delivered by NC State Executive Education, which includes the completion of 4 blended learning modules over the course of 6 weeks. These modules include: studying Python as object-oriented language, understanding conditionals and iterators, and developing the skills necessary to index, slice, and stride data.

Earners of this badge complete 4 projects, each requiring the use of analytic tools to extract valuable insights from data and apply the knowledge and skills developed in each session of the learning program. Projects include: (1) Create a WordCloud for given data using Jupyter Notebook, (2) Use Python conditionals to filter ROIs, 3) Understand applications of preprocessing and looping over data, 4) Find Palindromes from data using indexing, slicing, and striding techniques.

813537ce-513c-49ab-b1eb-6acab30fefe4.description: Earners of the UiPath RPA Foundation badge have developed foundational knowledge and skills to create automation projects with the UiPath platform. Earners have demonstrated understanding of the UiPath RPA software, their ability to lead robotics projects, and their ability to create robotic use cases.
813537ce-513c-49ab-b1eb-6acab30fefe4.name: Digital Process Automation - UiPath RPA Foundation

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the RPA Developer Foundation Online Learning Plan or an equivalent class taught by the UiPath vendor partner to develop essential knowledge of the UiPath software including theoretical concepts and business applications.

Demonstrate capabilities to design and develop simple, local, task automation solutions as part of projects that are evaluated during the education program. Incorporate feedback from instruction, assessments, and evaluations to build on design and development skills.

67d27e21-08e8-496a-a5a9-abea71c85ec9.description: Earners of this badge have developed, practiced, and demonstrated the capabilities to Think Data at Blue Cross NC. Earners approach business problems with a data literate mindset and have demonstrated the ability to analyze, interpret, and present data accurately. They understand data governance and data stewardship best practices and standards, understand how to utilize data visualizations effectively, and can leverage Excel to to solve business problems using data analytics.
67d27e21-08e8-496a-a5a9-abea71c85ec9.name: Data Literacy Foundation

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the Blue Cross NC Data Foundations web-based training course.
Successfully complete the Data Governance web-based training course.
Successfully complete the Introduction to Data Quality web-based training course.
Develop your skills in understanding, using, reading, and interpreting data by completing The Data Literacy Course: Learn How to Work With Data.
Expand on basic Excel skills and learn about tools, tips and tricks that will save you time and help you perform data analytics by completing Excel Data Analytics with Tools, Tips, and Tricks Part 1.
Further develop your capabilities to leverage Excel for data analytics and making better business decisions by completing Excel Data Analytics with Tools, Tips, and Tricks Part 2.
Take your data visualization skills to the next level by completing the Data Visualization Foundations course

Learn how to think critically about data by asking appropriate questions, identifying patterns and gaps, and determining how to leverage insights from data by completing Fundamentals of Data Analytics with Excel (formerly Data Analytics 102). Completion of this course includes applying data analysis knowledge and strategies in a case study group project.
Leverage the Data Literacy Knowledge Check to continuously develop the skills to Think Data and earn at least 700 neurons each quarter.

c994e32b-6037-4e9b-8885-09693929a503.description: Earners of the Data Science Bronze badge have developed an understanding of the foundational taxonomy of data science to speak with fluency in data science terminology and confidently communicate with data science professionals on use of analytics to improve decision-making. They are competent in the language and impact of data science, the principles of structured and unstructured data, probability, statistics, modeling, machine learning, and how to communicate analysis through visualization.
c994e32b-6037-4e9b-8885-09693929a503.name: Data Science - Bronze

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Introduction to Data Science Principles course delivered by NC State Executive Education, including all course assignments.
Complete the ROI: The Business Impact of Data Science course delivered by NC State Executive Education, including all course assignments.
Complete the Introduction to Structured and Unstructured Data course delivered by NC State Executive Education, including all course assignments.
Complete the Introduction to Probability & Statistics course delivered by NC State Executive Education, including all course assignments.
Complete the Introduction to Modeling & Machine Learning course delivered by NC State Executive Education, including all course assignments.
Leverage the Data Literacy Knowledge Check to continuously develop the skills to Think Data and earn at least 700 neurons each quarter.

efe6e229-d61f-404d-ba99-c88426077acb.description: Earners of the UiPath RPA Developer Silver badge have developed and demonstrated advanced knowledge and skills in UiPath RPA development and are qualified to develop and deploy bots in the Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina production environment.
efe6e229-d61f-404d-ba99-c88426077acb.name: Digital Process Automation - UiPath RPA Developer - Silver

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina Advanced RPA Developer Learning Pathway, including the RPA Developer Advanced Online Learning Plan or equivalent class taught by a UiPath vendor partner (totaling 43 - 50 hours of education).

Complete the Blue Cross NC UiPath Fundamentals course to develop and demonstrate understanding of the Blue Cross NC UiPath Operating Model; UiPath standards and best practices when building automation processes; UiPath resources, templates and snippets utilized at Blue Cross NC for bot development; and the phases of the SDLC Process at Blue Cross NC.

Complete the Advanced RPA Developer Hands-On Activity to apply and practice UiPath skills from RPA Developer Foundation training to develop a Use Case Development Project. The activity will be guided and evaluated by the UiPath mentor.

Demonstrate 100% skill mastery in the evaluation of an SDLC/Robotics Capstone Project for the following skills: 1) Utilize UiPath Blue Cross NC standards and best practices when building automation processes, 2) Develop an automation (use case) using UiPath applications and Blue Cross NC UiPath templates and snippets, and 3) Apply the Blue Cross NC SDLC process throughout the completion of the use case Capstone Project.

72a618c0-08e8-439e-94ca-47e02e1ee71a.description: Earners of the Project Architecture Bronze badge have assisted in producing project architecture deliverables in order to align project work with our enterprise strategies and standards to help the projects deliver greater value and stay on schedule.
72a618c0-08e8-439e-94ca-47e02e1ee71a.name: Project Architecture - Bronze

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Contribute as a Solution Architect (not necessarily the lead) on three projects. Help manage requirements, research background material, and produce at least one architecture deliverable for each project.
Receive coaching from a more experienced Solution Architect (i.e., someone with at least the Silver Project Architecture badge or higher).

22d0a07e-36be-4d8b-b221-0c27d875eb89.description: Earners of the ArchiMate Design Bronze badge have acquired foundational ArchiMate notation education leading to communicating complex designs.
22d0a07e-36be-4d8b-b221-0c27d875eb89.name: ArchiMate Design - Bronze

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the ArchiMate Solution Architecture Training course covering the Application and Relationships elements.

Receive coaching from an experienced ArchiMate designer as you create a diagram for an architecture specification. The diagram can be completed collaboratively and with coaching support. Meet the criteria for completing the diagram to Architecture Review Board (ARB) specifications.

b74ff96a-925b-4c6c-9c81-76a31b8d8b78.description: Earners of the UiPath Insights badge have developed foundational knowledge and skills to define KPIs and develop dashboards to analyze and communicate bot performance metrics to business stakeholders. The DPA UiPath Insights badge supports increased organizational efficiency by building skills in automation analytics and bot performance monitoring to quickly identify and address issues for optimization of bot performance and reduce the amount of bot support needed by IT.
b74ff96a-925b-4c6c-9c81-76a31b8d8b78.name: Digital Process Automation - UiPath Insights

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Build foundational knowledge of RPA and automation by successfully completing the Introduction to RPA and Automation digital course provided by UiPath Academy.

Discover the UiPath RPA Development ecosystem, how to set up a UiPath Studio environment, and build an automation process in the Get Started with RPA Development digital course provided by UiPath Academy.
Develop and demonstrate knowledge of automation analytics and practice using UiPath Insights during the UiPath Cloud Insights digital course provided by UiPath Academy.

Practice using the UiPath Insights RPA analytics tool and measuring bots and RPA performance in the UiPath Insights course delivered by Roboyo. Successfully complete the course, including all course assignments.

Apply and demonstrate your skills in UiPath Insights by developing a dashboard and completing the UiPath Insights Capstone Project. Your final dashboard will be evaluated to assess your skill mastery and feedback will be provided to support the development of your skills.
Continuously develop your skills in UiPath Insights by completing 3 hours annually of recommended continuous learning activities.

a596dfd9-7e1e-483c-b58a-674057507e42.description: Earners of the Domain Architecture (Solution Architecture) Bronze badge have explored Blue Cross NC domain models and given particular attention to their focal domain in order to align project work with domain strategies and to develop and drive those strategies.

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Explore existing Domain Architecture materials in all domains.
Meet with the Domain Architect for your specific focus area and review that domain in detail.
Contribute to updating existing Domain Architecture materials such that the Domain Architect incorporates your updates for at least one project into the published Domain Architecture.

983d5533-4fdc-456d-a363-98954c5c420e.description: Earners of the Solution Architecture Design Conventions Bronze badge have applied the expected modeling conventions with collaboration and support in order to improve design clarity.
983d5533-4fdc-456d-a363-98954c5c420e.name: Solution Architecture Design Conventions - Bronze

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Review the Architecture Modeling Conventions.
Complete diagrams for three non-trivial architecture specifications, have them approved by the Architecture Review Board (ARB), and correct any missed conventions as recommended.
Receive coaching from a more experienced Blue Cross NC Architect as you create the diagrams for this badge.

1eb96f28-dbeb-488e-bcc9-ffe089950809.description: Earners of the Solution Architecture Design Conventions Silver badge have applied Blue Cross NC modeling conventions to improve design clarity accurately and independently.
1eb96f28-dbeb-488e-bcc9-ffe089950809.name: Solution Architecture Design Conventions - Silver

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

alignments.name: Blue Cross NC Architecture Modeling Guide

badge_template_activities.title: Earn the Solution Architecture Design Conventions Bronze badge or equivalent.

Complete diagrams with Architecture Review Board (ARB) approval for two non-trivial architecture specifications AND follow the Architecture Modeling Conventions without needing substantial correction from the Architecture Review Board (ARB).
Receive coaching from a more experienced Blue Cross NC Architect as you create the diagrams for this badge.

a222e048-ec91-4a78-bedb-0e0816e32eb6.description: Earners of the Domain Architecture (Solution Architecture) Gold badge have led a domain area as well as demonstrated a pattern of reusing assets in order to align project work with domain strategies and to develop and drive those strategies.
a222e048-ec91-4a78-bedb-0e0816e32eb6.name: Domain Architecture (Solution Architecture) - Gold

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Earn the Domain Architecture Silver badge or equivalent.

Lead one area of Domain Architecture (be a Domain Architect). Establish and maintain current, transitional, and future state views of your domain. Work with business and IT stakeholders to identify and address challenges and opportunities.

Support reuse two ways: (1) by harvesting at least 2 additional non-trivial domain architecture assets (beyond what you did for the Silver badge) and organizing them for reuse and (2) by reusing in your domain architecture at least 2 additional non-trivial domain or project asset previously harvested. These assets can be reference architectures, standards, or patterns. Architecture Review Board (ARB) approval is required.

a79c4031-469f-4f5d-9dc1-93da285081af.description: Earners of the Domain Architecture (Solution Architecture) Silver badge have contributed to the maintenance of domain models as well as supported basic reuse of assets in order to align project work with domain strategies and to develop and drive those strategies.
a79c4031-469f-4f5d-9dc1-93da285081af.name: Domain Architecture (Solution Architecture) - Silver

badge_template_activities.title: Earn the Domain Architecture Bronze badge or equivalent.

Contribute to updating existing Domain Architecture materials such that the Domain Architect incorporates your update into the published Domain Architecture for at least two more projects. Receive coaching from the Domain Architect in the process.

Support reuse two ways: (1) by harvesting at least 1 non-trivial domain architecture asset and organizing it for reuse and (2) by reusing in your domain architecture at least 1 non-trivial domain or project asset previously harvested. These assets can be reference architectures, standards, or patterns. Architecture Review Board (ARB) approval is required.

6c43bed5-a935-4b29-aa5d-e4e843814628.description: Earners of the ArchiMate Design Gold badge have applied ArchiMate to communicate complex designs accurately and independently.
6c43bed5-a935-4b29-aa5d-e4e843814628.name: ArchiMate Design - Gold

Review ArchiMate standard and/or certification self-study guide. Expand your coverage to include the Strategy and Motivation layers.

Complete diagrams for two non-trivial architecture specifications including Architecture Review Board (ARB) approval and use proper ArchiMate presentation without needing substantial correction from the Architecture Review Board (ARB) or from a mentor.

b77b9c2a-f7e1-4b95-850b-851648f3fc88.description: Earners of the ArchiMate Design Silver badge have applied ArchiMate to communicate complex designs with collaboration and support.
b77b9c2a-f7e1-4b95-850b-851648f3fc88.name: ArchiMate Design - Silver

badge_template_activities.title: Earn the ArchiMate Design Bronze badge or equivalent.
Complete diagrams for three non-trivial architecture specifications, have them reviewed by the Architecture Review Board (ARB), and make ArchiMate adjustments as recommended.
Receive coaching from a more experienced ArchiMate designer as you create the diagrams for this badge. Expand your coverage to include the Business and Technology layers.

8ce6cde0-b1da-457b-82af-d2ee1e7e3aae.description: Earners of the Certified UiPath RPA Developer Gold badge have participated in continuous learning opportunities in advanced UiPath RPA development and acquired at least six months of experience building UiPath bots full time, demonstrating that they can successfully develop and deploy stable bots that meet standards verified by the Blue Cross NC internal review board.
8ce6cde0-b1da-457b-82af-d2ee1e7e3aae.name: Digital Process Automation - UiPath RPA Developer - Gold

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Build UiPath bots for at least six months full time. Bots should meet Blue Cross NC internal standards verified by board review. Successfully develop and deploy three bots to production that show stability two months post warranty.
Pass the UiPath Certified Advanced RPA Developer (UiARD) exam and requirements.

Upon successful completion of the bot production criteria and UiPath Certified Advanced RPA Developer exam, submit your request to be issued this badge to Blue U through Ask@Work. Your request should include the names and deployment date of the bots developed to meet the criteria and the UiPath Certified Advanced RPA Developer exam certificate.

1d12c416-e840-40be-8abf-34f9b4b1aae6.description: Earners of the Project Architecture Gold badge have led multiple project architecture efforts throughout the whole project life-cycle and demonstrated a pattern of reusing architecture assets in order to align project work with our enterprise strategies and standards to ensure that the projects deliver greater value and stay on schedule.
1d12c416-e840-40be-8abf-34f9b4b1aae6.name: Project Architecture - Gold

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Earn the Project Architecture Silver badge or equivalent.

Serve as the Lead Project Architect on the full life-cycle of two non-trivial projects (Pre-Discovery through Warranty). As with the Silver badge, serving as the LPA involves comprehensive project documentation and supporting materials as well as Architecture Review Board (ARB) approval. Also, receive coaching from a more experienced Solution Architect in the process of completing the Project Architecture deliverables.

Support reuse two ways: (1) by harvesting at least 2 additional non-trivial project architecture assets (in addition to work done to earn the Silver badge) and organizing them for reuse and (2) by reusing in your project architecture at least 2 additional non-trivial domain or project assets previously harvested. These assets can be reference architectures, standards, or patterns. Architecture Review Board (ARB) approval is required.

a72409e4-0d07-4421-b043-fe00eb47300e.description: Earners of the Project Architecture Silver badge have led multiple project architecture efforts and demonstrated basic reuse of architecture assets in order to align project work with our enterprise strategies and standards to help the projects deliver greater value and stay on schedule.
a72409e4-0d07-4421-b043-fe00eb47300e.name: Project Architecture - Silver

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Earn the Project Architecture Bronze badge or equivalent.

Serve as the Lead Project Architect on three non-trivial projects. Maintain comprehensive project documentation in Aardvark as well as supporting materials in SPARC. Achieve Architecture Review Board (ARB) approval on Scoping-level designs. Massive projects with multiple deliveries can count multiple times. Also, receive coaching from a more experienced Solution Architect in the process of completing the Project Architecture deliverables.

Support reuse two ways: (1) by harvesting at least 3 non-trivial project architecture assets and organizing them for reuse and (2) by reusing in your project architectures at least 1 non-trivial domain or project asset previously harvested. These assets can be reference architectures, standards, or patterns. Architecture Review Board (ARB) approval is required.

8e4f2a99-84eb-42a1-a232-f6d9b537cb96.description: Earners of the Solution Architecture Design Conventions Gold badge have applied our modeling conventions to improve design clarity and demonstrated the ability to coach others in Design Conventions.
8e4f2a99-84eb-42a1-a232-f6d9b537cb96.name: Solution Architecture Design Conventions - Gold

badge_template_activities.title: Earn the Solution Architecture Design Conventions Silver badge or equivalent.

Coach someone on three non-trivial architecture designs. Review their materials and help them adhere to Blue Cross NC design conventions such that they can pass Architecture Review Board (ARB) review without needing substantial correction.

aea0dbee-f209-4101-9090-f7428df244f3.description: Earners of the ArchiMate Platinum Design badge have mastered ArchiMate and demonstrated the ability to coach others in ArchiMate design.
aea0dbee-f209-4101-9090-f7428df244f3.name: ArchiMate Design - Platinum

Mentor at least two people on a total of three ArchiMate designs. Review their materials and help them adhere to correct ArchiMate notation such that they can pass Architecture Review Board (ARB) review without needing substantial correction.

64a8f1b1-9c41-41f6-b306-35ea7f432bb1.description: Earners of the Customer Service Bronze digital credential have acquired insights and techniques that will help them deliver first-class, optimal customer experience within a range of different situations. They have mastered core soft skills required for customer service excellence, practiced their communication and rapport-building skills and established the basic knowledge foundation to effectively support customers and drive impactful customer service culture within the organization.
64a8f1b1-9c41-41f6-b306-35ea7f432bb1.name: Customer Service - Bronze

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Graduate from Customer Service new hire training with a passing score of 85% or higher on all examinations. Successfully complete all coaching interaction segments during on-the-job training periods by making the necessary adjustments provided by your coach.
Demonstrate the following skills attained from Essential Habits 1, 2 and 3 training: Establishing Credibility, Asking Insightful Questions, and Making Things Easy

Practice and strengthen skills in handling customer interactions, accurately resolving claims, and providing excellent service with the Customer Service Certification study guide to prepare for the Mastery of Customer Service Certification. Successfully pass all e-learning modules and practice quizzes.
Pass the Core Service Certification Exam with a minimum score of 90%.

Demonstrate the appropriate proficiency according to role type for three consecutive months and maintain that proficiency level. This would be 67% and above individual FCR for phone staff. Non-phone staff would achieve the minimum metric in alignment to their respective team.
Strengthen and reinforce skills in Customer Service Excellence annually by completing a learning pathway for continuous development.

bb47f3bb-fb5c-4772-b664-63a847fca425.description: Earners of the Customer Service Skills Coaching - Bronze digital credential have developed and demonstrated skills to identify the pivotal behavior to coach to for the greatest impact: refine, redirect or reinforce. They have participated in calibrations with certified Customer Service Master Coaches to implement best practices and the techniques to provide just-in-time feedback for coaching.
bb47f3bb-fb5c-4772-b664-63a847fca425.name: Customer Service Skills Coaching - Bronze

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 8 hours of Customer Service Mentor Training, including 9 Ulysses competencies and how they impact the customer experience.

Complete 8 hours of Customer Service Coaching Mentor Training which covers the IDEA coaching methodology and an overview of Reinforce, Refine, and Redirect as it relates to customer service skills coaching.

Apply and practice Customer Service skills coaching in calibration sessions that provide application of skills in customer-focused situations. Lead calibrations with a certified Customer Service Master Coach to demonstrate competency of coaching mentor training. Demonstrate the ability to effectively utilize IDEA methodology in a calibration.
Apply and demonstrate skills on the job for a minimum of 25 hours of Customer Service skills coaching experience.

52e430cc-4e35-4e4e-9fae-b563919c09e0.description: Earners of the Customer Service Skills Coaching - Silver digital credential have developed and demonstrated skills to leverage data to support customer service skills coaching sessions and apply the appropriate coaching model for their audience. They participated in learning from contact center industry experts on best practices to understand techniques and pitfalls to avoid in the skills coaching process. They understand and exhibit Blue Cross NC models for skills coaching and leadership.
52e430cc-4e35-4e4e-9fae-b563919c09e0.name: Customer Service Skills Coaching - Silver

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete all 8 sessions of the Certification program for Customer Service skills coaching, including the coaching storyboard capstone project.

Apply and practice Customer Service skills coaching in two live virtual reality learning simulations that provide practice in realistic situations. Apply feedback given from the sessions to improve skills.
Complete at least 1 calibration to continue to expand upon skills acquired during the certification program.
Apply and demonstrate skills on the job for a minimum of 50 hours of Customer Service skills coaching experience.
Demonstrate proficiency with a 2 - 4 increase in team FCR and maintain that proficiency level.

Complete at least 1 workshop to continue developing skills that support effective Customer Service skills coaching, such as time management, data analysis, and coaching skills. Continue to work on monthly required calibrations and workshops.

647130df-8243-43e7-a12d-22a72aa3cf94.description: Earners of the Domain Architecture (Solution Architecture) Platinum badge have demonstrated thought leadership, namely by coaching others in Domain Architecture practices.
647130df-8243-43e7-a12d-22a72aa3cf94.name: Domain Architecture (Solution Architecture) - Platinum

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Earn the Domain Architecture Gold badge or equivalent.
Coach another Domain Architect in achieving the Domain Architecture Gold badge.

8ea2172e-65c5-4f28-a033-5b1facd66042.description: Earners of the Escalation Management – Silver badge have demonstrated the ability to proactively and successfully manage top-tier customer escalations by leveraging data points, interpersonal skills, and subject knowledge to resolve and provide end-to-end resolution of customer interactions. Those who achieve this level of expertise are competent and well-versed in leveraging customer service, business acumen, and industry-specific skills.
8ea2172e-65c5-4f28-a033-5b1facd66042.name: Escalation Management - Silver

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: In preparation for this badge, the prerequisite is to complete a Blue Cross NC Customer Service Badge at a minimum of the Bronze level or have one year of experience in an escalation management role. In lieu of these prerequisites, a recommendation from your leader to pursue this badge can be submitted to Tamika Lloyd.

Build skills in communication by successfully completing the following courses: Communicating with Clarity, Resolving Conflict, Better Business Writing, and Great Grammar Guidelines for the Workplace.

Demonstrate the following skills attained from Essential Habits 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 training: closing the feedback loop based off of areas of opportunity identified through escalation, aligning how coaching and feedback is delivered based on the Essential Habits Framework, and listening for opportunities to coach Customer Service Professionals on exceptional service skills.

Demonstrate capabilities to Think Data and apply data-driven decision making after completion of Blue Cross NC Data Foundations, Excel Data Analytics with Tools, Tips, and Tricks Part 1 and Part 2, and Fundamentals of Data Analytics with Excel courses.

Successfully complete the Mastering Emotional Intelligence training course to improve self-reflection and find opportunities to improve self-awareness, team collaboration and communication with members to build rapport and trust.

Take the Lean Methodology training course and apply the skills learned by identifying waste and opportunities for improvement that would aid in escalation management, including improving the feedback loop across different channels.

Meet the minimum level of quality metrics for your role and maintain for three months. Demonstrate time management, conflict resolution, research (assessed through quality), and empathy (assessed through quality, member feedback, and review of case work). Demonstrate mastery of de-escalation skills (through assessment of quality and case work).

Consistently maintain the minimum quality metrics as defined by your leader (validated every three months). Six months after earning the badge, participate in a learning simulation to practice de-escalation and communication techniques and receive feedback for continuous development. Participate in regular knowledge checks and review recommended resources regularly.

9e6f0437-c069-4350-af85-9315517806ae.description: Earners of the Project Architecture Platinum badge have demonstrated thought leadership, namely by coaching others in project architecture activities.
9e6f0437-c069-4350-af85-9315517806ae.name: Project Architecture - Platinum

issuer.summary: issued by Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

entity.name: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina

badge_template_activities.title: Earn the Project Architecture Gold badge or equivalent.
Coach someone through creating specs for three non-trivial projects. Help them work through the complexities of the content as well as execution in our governance process and systems.
